titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kathleen Brady Papers on Ida Tarbell, 1976-1990 SC.1992.01
titlestmt.author: Christine Lavigna and Mary Margaret Fletcher.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:31:39 -0400.

did.unittitle: Kathleen Brady Papers on Ida Tarbell
did.abstract: Ida Tarbell was a pioneering investigative journalist from Western Pennsylvania and who gained fame for her 1904 expose of Standard Oil. This collection consists of manuscripts and research materials that her biographer, Kathleen Brady, accumulated over the course of writing a book about Tarbell during the early 1980s.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was inventoried and rehoused by Christine Lavigna in 1992. She added a more detailed container list to the inventory in 1996.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Kathleen Brady Papers on Ida Tarbell, 1976-1990, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kathleen Brady Papers on Ida Tarbell, 1976-1990, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kathleen Brady on April 15, 1992.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Kathleen Brady is the author of Ida Tarbell: Portrait of a Muckraker, published in 1984 by Seaview/Putnam and again in 1989 by the University of Pittsburgh Press. Tarbell (1857-1944) was born in Erie County, Pa., and graduated from Allegheny College in 1880. She is considered by some to be the first investigative reporter. She wrote biographies of Napoleon Bonaparte and Abraham Lincoln, but is best known for her exposeÃÅ, History of the Standard Oil Company, published in 1904.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Originally received in six archival storage cartons, the collection contains articles, photographs, and notes used by Kathleen Brady in her research on the book; manuscripts of the book; correspondence between the author and publishers; book reviews; and permission and grant requests. Brady's research began in approximately 1980 and she completed her book in 1983.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The Ida M. Tarbell Collection, Pelletier Library, Allegheny College
Ida M. Tarbell Collection, Drake Well Museum Library
Ida M. Tarbell Papers, MSS413, Ohio University, Athens, Ohio

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection retains its original order, with a very small number of item refiled to better reflect their intellectual content. It has been divided into the following series:
Series III. Research on Ida Tarbell, 1976-1990

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of drafts and edited versions of Kathleen Brady's working manuscript for Ida Tarbell: Portrait of a Muckraker. Many are pasted together and/or heavily annotated.

did.unittitle: Part II: Success (D.C) - Typed Manuscript and Copy
Chapters 11 and 12: Work Horse and At Rest, Drafts
Pre-Standard Oil Manuscript - Part III: Success

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The items in this series document the logistical process of publishing Brady's biography of Tarbell. This includes such materials as correspondence with publishers, permissions paperwork, and publicity materials such as press inquiries and reviews.

did.unittitle: Proposal of Biography of Ida M. Tarbell
Larry's Edit - Part 1 and Part II
Larry's Edit - Part II: Success (Later Part III)
Bound Galleys: Correspondence - Book Review Requests

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This largest of the three series consists of Brady's notes and source materials for the Tarbell biography, remaining in Brady's original arrangement by subject and mostly with her original folder headings. Many folders contain photocopies of archival materials that Brady consulted at various repositories. She often labeled those research folders with the dates of the original manuscripts. In those cases, the dates became part of the folder title and were put in quotation marks. Also included are notes, scraps of draft materials, and a large number of index cards that Brady used during the course of her research.

did.unittitle: Misc. Research - Esp. on Chautauqua, Childhood, Oil in PA
World War I/Women's Committee on the Council of National Defense
Chester H. Rowell and Ida Tarbell Interview
The Biz of Being a Woman
